name: Hotel Berial

reviews.text: Excellent location just 5 minutes from the hotel, i stayed here whilst going to the world cup football at the Fan Fest in Gelsenkirchen. The tram stop is just 2 minutes walk if that!! Breakfast was nice but get down early because it does go quickly if lots of people are staying well by 9.30am not much left!! Hotel reception are fantastic and very friendly and 99% of them speak English, room was cleaned every morning and fresh towels provided. Try and request one of the modern rooms as the older rooms have not yet been updated and look a bit dull but my room was fantastic for any solo travellers request the modern single room.
reviews.title: Fantastic 3 nights

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a small, unpretentious Hotel offering virtually nothing in the way of facilities other than a Reception area and Breakfast Room, but is very centrally situated within easy walking distance of all the shops, the Aldstat and the Rhine. A cab from the airport is around 18 euros and it's 4 stops on Tram 707 from the main station (too far to walk with luggage).
reviews.title: The Berial Chamber

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As you would expect the Hotel is well-managed and the rooms clean and functional. The rooms on the corner of the building are appreciably larger then the others and there is a non-smoking floor. (Why is smoking still allowed in Hotels,Restuarants, Pubs, Cafes etc. in Germany??). Most rooms appear to have a shower but no bath. We found the reception staff to be helpful, knowledgable and multi-lingual and the housekeeping staff dealt with our requests quickly and cheerfully. The breakfast was served at flexble times and was adequate without being boundless in choice.
reviews.title: Nice place for the money

reviews.text: We found a remarkably cheap deal for B & B at 30 euros a night each from Hotels De.com, which represents extraordinarily good value for what is a very friendly, clean, convenient and functional Hotel - easy to see why it gets good ratings.
reviews.title: Perfect!

reviews.text: The property was very nice for the money ($65 euros per night for a double). Nice location not too far from the main areas in Dusseldorf.
reviews.title: Great value Berial
fantastic hotel, good price
reviews.text: The 3 of us stayed at this Hotel Berial on September 7 for one night only. Unfortunately, we would have loved to have stayed longer to enjoy the comfort and charm of this lovely hotel for a couple of more days, but we were on an overnight layover only. Their staff were all so friendly and helpful. Justine at the front desk was resourceful and spoke in English. Our room which cost us 65 euro for a double was a steal of a deal. The room was clean and organized. The bathroom was spacious and water pressure was powerful. We even had the use of the desktop computer in the business center for free to check emails and search the web. The lobby and breakfast room(s) were decorated nicely in modern decor. The breakfast buffet is above average which is included in the cost of the room. Large selection of fruits, cereal, and dairy. I highly recommend this hotel to everyone. The hotel is a close 10-15 min walk to the business shopping center.

description: If you are looking for a well-priced hotel in the city centre, we are the perfect place for your stay. Our modern city hotel offers you individual service in a stylish aambience and tranquil atmosphere in the tradition of the typical "Düsseldorf" hospitality.
